com.madisp.stupid.context

Class VarContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.madisp.stupid.context.BaseContext
      • com.madisp.stupid.context.VarContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExecContext

    public class VarContext
extends BaseContext
    An ExecContext backed by a Map of variables. Enables the script to create new variables. One may also provide a set of constants by providing a Map when constructing.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  VarContext.Type
      The type of the VarContext.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Create a new immutable context with a set of variables.
      VarContext(VarContext.Type type)
      Create a new context with the given type and no starting variables.
      VarContext(VarContext.Type type, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> vars)
      Create a new context with the given type and a set of variables

      • getFieldValue

        public java.lang.Object getFieldValue(java.lang.Object root,
                             java.lang.String identifier)
                               throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        Description copied from interface: ExecContext
        Get a field value from the environment.
        Specified by:
        getFieldValue in interface ExecContext
        Overrides:
        getFieldValue in class BaseContext
        Parameters:
        root - The object whose field value is being queried. May be null which semantically means getting a value from the "scope" or ExecContext itself.
        identifier - field identifier
        Returns:
        the Java value of the given field
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - if field was not found / getting value is not supported

      • setFieldValue

        public java.lang.Object setFieldValue(java.lang.Object root,
                             java.lang.String identifier,
                             java.lang.Object value)
                               throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
        Description copied from interface: ExecContext
        Assigns a value to a field in the environment.
        Specified by:
        setFieldValue in interface ExecContext
        Overrides:
        setFieldValue in class BaseContext
        Parameters:
        root - The object whose field value is being set. May be null which semantically means getting a value from the "scope" or ExecContext itself.
        identifier - field identifier
        value - the new value for the field
        Returns:
        if successful, the value itself
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchFieldException - if the field was not found / setting values is not supported
